reviewText: Great storyline and the acting was okay. L.A. have been having gang problems for decades. Now Central America is being terrorize by United States bred.
Great moving about men. I like how they hid the gang colors as to not give credit to gangs.

A beautiful movie. The problems addressed are real, and this film portrays them without cheap sentimentalism. The story is true and the people portrayed are real people -- and the acting makes them truly come alive for the watcher. It's a wonderful reminder of what miracles can occur when we submit ourselves to God's will and how our availability is more important than our ability.

And watch out for Avan Jogia. He plays this role so real that nothing but the character remains -- the actor disappears. I don't think it will be long until he is recognized widely as a power house of an actor.
Story is very moving despite low production level. Avan Jogia makes you care so deeply about this boys fate.
